5A3A4833810E4D179AECCD8DFDA16340.description:
What effects have La Société Radio-Canada (SRC) and the Canadian Broadcasting
Corporation (CBC) had on Canadian identity?

6C380595C998408885360E6914895EB1.description:
In what ways did technological advances contribute to the development of Canada
(e.g., aviation, farming equipment, radio transmissions, electronics, multimedia)?

B9961AD1DB24454C9D2CC1BB7584C4E5.description:
How did the emergence of large factories in Canada contribute to the development of
Canada’s economy?

91AC951F7C154596965E8329E582DDC8.description: What impact has increased urbanization had on rural communities in Canada?

F1654D2AA97A4EEC89E27ABC375BA608.description:
Assess, critically, the impact of urbanization and of technology on individual and collective
identities in Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

D3DEFC5AE4E3466B96B9E1A99D11D418.description:
What strategies and conditions are needed for the Franco-Albertan community to counter
assimilation?

6C4AFB45C60A4423B587FB16084BB6FB.description:
How have Canadian immigration policies contributed to increased diversity and
multiculturalism within the Canadian population?

7769CB28F2FA40ACBCE7C32EDC4573C1.description: How has the Official Languages Act contributed to bilingualism in Canada?

F8157FD1BDA9441691954D23A0F68540.description:
What challenges and opportunities have emerged as a result of increases in the Aboriginal
population in western Canada?

F3CABE4A04904A8DAD39AAE2A3C2EA5D.description:
What are the social and economic effects of the changing roles and images of women in
Canadian society (i.e., right to vote, working conditions, changing family structures)?

F85162549D684BDFBCE246DFB0108136.description: How did joining Confederation impact the citizens of Newfoundland?

35FCED23BB8243C7B7C7627E8248E1C7.description:
What were the reasons for, and the consequences of, Newfoundland’s joining
Confederation?

548AAC3DD74E4E5B8261E81E7C3FFA6B.description:
Assess, critically, the impacts of social and political changes on individual and collective
identities in Canada since 1918 by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions
and issues:

613650BC2E384AFBB8EEEE801C318B66.description: What were the underlying reasons for the negotiation of the numbered treaties?

BED51876DBB647749BEC21C5FC0E7D52.description:
How were the needs of varied populations considered through the creation of Alberta and of
Saskatchewan?

04B127ED0E404F97B1885E8DC4D93ADA.description: What factors led to Prince Edward Island’s joining Confederation?

3CA44B3015504B75B95431EC431C63C5.description: What factors led to British Columbia’s joining Confederation?

0B13670BC9F74D67873E8CB11020D609.description:
To what extent was agricultural activity a key factor in the population growth of western
Canada?

662048AC8F844F22AE644EA5DE2B6D93.description:
How did immigrants from eastern Europe contribute to the development of western Canada
(i.e., health, education, churches, commerce, politics, journalism, agriculture)?

1100FF809C8A4CBCB9466EE739792532.description:
How did communities, services and businesses established by Francophones contribute to
the overall development of western Canada (i.e., health, education, churches, commerce,
politics, journalism, agriculture)?

C0B9B1A687674E5DBF64CDF71DCC0E86.description: What impact did immigration have on Aboriginal peoples and on communities in Canada?

74DAEED1B56D481DAC65ECB488DE8C77.description:
What strategies were used by religious communities and missionaries to encourage
migration and immigration to western Canada from eastern Canada and the United States?

BC5F4FB4F7F243AC95A6B640C567605D.description: What strategies were used by the government to encourage immigration from Europe?

76F61EEFCF6C47BCBE5C214E9D5E4284.description:
What was the role of the North West Mounted Police in the development of western
Canada?

B7E362C4B15742EE8EFF7E0F7E82897D.description: In what ways did the building of the Canadian Pacific Railway affect the growth of Canada?

FA49810C99354E0EBDD04090C4D82EA9.description:
How did Asian immigrants contribute to the development of Canada (i.e., Chinese railway
workers)?

0E1FB4C33DF9489F95AA0F13B7352329.description:
How did changing demographics resulting from Clifford Sifton’s immigration policies affect
the collective identity of Francophones in communities across western Canada?

39CE205DF4FB435684BD8147BD594826.description:
How did the National Policy determine the economic and demographic aspects of Canadian
expansion?

0A663B2BFFB949669802E18DF24116A4.description: What factors led to the purchase of Rupert’s Land in 1869?

A43669FF16A44AE783093406EA7F9B4C.description:
Evaluate the impact of Confederation and of subsequent immigration on Canada from 1867
to the First World War by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

EEF14847B5CA48C68C10ADD71CA32D0D.description:
To what extent were the Manitoba Schools Act and evolving educational legislation in the
Northwest Territories attempts to impose a British identity in western Canada?

8B0ADC1AEB114AF3B30B95775D4EE26F.description:
How was the creation of Manitoba an attempt to achieve compromise between the Métis,
First Nations, French and British peoples?

553890D6C5744A569B4B87B262FD1956.description:
What were the Métis, First Nations, French and British perspectives on the events that led to
the establishment of Manitoba?

7B1616ED652C4494AB037CAAE05E508D.description:
To what extent were the Red River Resistance and the second Métis uprising means to
counter assimilation?

AFE5FA4F9CC949ED9059C3CE9569BC10.description:
How did the Government of Canada’s response to the Red River Resistance and the second
Métis uprising solidify Canada’s control of the West?

353453A46B924AC89B311A60E8C6DF6A.description:
What similarities and differences exist between the causes of the Red River Resistance in
1869 and the causes of the second Métis uprising in 1885?

D08B331F547746E6A1BDB0C959A9FB8C.description: What factors led to Louis Riel’s emergence as the leader of the Métis?

D9BFB925568F488E81A52CB2ADD173B6.description: Assess, critically, the role, contributions and influence of the Red River Métis on the development of western Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

E341AD42ED1248F28190E1FC825B3AC1.description:
Appreciate the challenges that individuals and communities face when confronted with
rapid change

A908C89EA86D4760B6C1505B98C122D3.description: Recognize the positive and negative consequences of political decisions

6F7DEF0E97434C7EA9B7D4E42713849F.description: Recognize the positive and negative aspects of immigration and migration

1073E386812B446ABEB89B770530D3BB.description:
Students will demonstrate an understanding and appreciation of how the political, demographic, economic
and social changes that have occurred since Confederation have presented challenges and opportunities
for individuals and communities.

71312653AD1C409886EA489BCF2E52C8.description: To what extent was Confederation an attempt to strengthen the Maritime colonies?

A0FD6D0639084C8BB95883CCB2CC4E40.description:
To what extent was Confederation an attempt to provide the populations of Québec and
Ontario with increased control over their own affairs?

E92508F9E7F640C2B6DA971D1420531F.description:
How was the Act of Union of 1840 an attempt to resolve the issues raised by the 1837 and
1838 Rebellions in Lower Canada and Upper Canada?

AC4DA81632054C839248041D1489D400.description:
How was the Great Migration of 1815–1850 in Upper Canada and Lower Canada an attempt
to confirm British identity in the Province of Canada?

7ED066A2BB55437BA2CBE8BCE5BFA528.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to defining Canada’s political boundaries?

444EAAFC6DDC440092B6D0CAEDC1B23E.description: How did the War of 1812 contribute to British identity in Canada?

8905068FA44444DEA313BBE51A09E82A.description: What was the role of Chief Tecumseh in the War of 1812?

6C064F1C479B4C2EB467EB9DC9902533.description:
How did the Québec Act of 1774 contribute to the foundations of Canada as an officially
bilingual country?

2E0DCC0980244072A656B9D41313606B.description:
How was the Royal Proclamation of 1763 an attempt to achieve compromise between the
Aboriginal peoples, the French and the British?

FD83199AB91645D2A36A9D9AD29CFBCB.description: What was the role and intent of Chief Pontiac in controlling British forts?

B1F4C8F5B78647F8959BF026B82342EB.description:
Assess, critically, how political, economic and military events contributed to the
foundations of Canada by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

673FD11411F34A92BD21818E6F1989CC.description:
How was British North America impacted by rebellion in the 13 colonies and by the
subsequent Loyalist migration?

60F7BE8CB4D544E88423B7DA8F4B2611.description:
To what extent was the Battle of the Plains of Abraham the key event in achieving British
control over North America?

952C88DC68E1427A9B2B1144F0734D58.description:
How did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe become factors in the Great
Deportation of the Acadians in 1755?

5E23F67342774F6E9D18B0352CAE58C1.description:
In what ways did conflicts between the French and the British in Europe impact North
America?

AB1DEA3B267E4AD09AF820924D408577.description:
Assess, critically, the political competition between the French and the British in
attempting to control North America by exploring and reflecting upon the following
questions and issues:

6F19AB357675497EACBC97900C424798.description: What was the role of mercantilism before and after the 1763 Treaty of Paris?

8AEB519E6DB545DA8E308C0C1781F82B.description:
How was economic development in New France impacted by the changing policies of the
French Royal Government?

9FBF5FFDC82148D2975443C6A992BB83.description: How was Britain’s interest in the fur trade different from that of New France?

15D65EADFAC54FD1A6A9FB1A7B3A6D3A.description: How did the fur trade contribute to the foundations of the economy in North America?

4CAEDDFD9FC44DE6AFDC2C114A15104A.description:
How did the First Nations, French, British and Métis peoples interact with each other as
participants in the fur trade?

38B4DC9B082044ABBEB5C773F4F470BA.description:
Assess, critically, the economic competition related to the control of the North American
fur trade by exploring and reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

BE84069EC7A248FABD5C37F27EF05205.description: What role did the British government play in the settlement of North America?

7F90E964F9AF4043B430C5DC16EBCF4D.description: Who were the key figures in the British exploration and settlement of North America?

8CEFF96368A14D1BB8AC3FAF30241D4E.description:
What roles did the Royal Government and the Catholic Church play in the social structure of
New France (i.e., governor, intendant, Jesuits, religious congregations)?

10A71458CFA84B33B671CEE25E25AC15.description: Who were the key figures in the French exploration and settlement of North America?

810EBF0782FC45CF8D61C2CFDC5722CC.description:
How was European imperialism responsible for the development of Acadia, New France and
British settlements?

36F75ED5C57B458E9034C01F33CDF727.description:
In what ways did European imperialism impact the social and economic structures of
Aboriginal societies?

835E2959190B4D6A93C5F698BB3E1910.description: What were the social and economic factors of European imperialism? (

A4770ACD3A744487A81B764DA6D3846C.description:
How did the structures of Aboriginal societies affect decision making in each society
(i.e., role and status of women, consensus building)?

131B200BE6B84133A442C1B7C0C18652.description:
What were the different ways in which Aboriginal societies were structured (i.e., Iroquois
Confederacy, Ojibwa, Mi’kmaq)?

97FA1504DB99483DBA24FDE76916A97C.description:
Compare and contrast diverse social and economic structures within the societies of
Aboriginal, French and British peoples in pre-Confederation Canada by exploring and
reflecting upon the following questions and issues:

7411CC1705804A94A7C7E706D74C25B2.description: Appreciate the challenges of co-existence among peoples

CAEED9D71E024AEFAF58AF0B80CD3C6D.description:
Appreciate the influence of diverse Aboriginal, French and British peoples on events
leading to Confederation

71260289FDC04C1F814C204337E514F2.description:
Students will demonstrate an understanding and appreciation of the distinct roles of, and the relationships
among, the Aboriginal, French and British peoples in forging the foundations of Canadian Confederation.
